snippet: Music, poetry and dance will play a role in the Museum of Modern Art’s “Inventing Abstraction, 1910-1925,” which opens Dec. 23.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; music, poetry and dance play role in the Museum of Modern Art’s Inventing Abstraction, 1910-1925; Jeff Koons is planning show at David Zwirner gallery, not Gagosian or Sonnaben where he has had longtime associations and exhibitions; Whitney curator Scott Rothkopf is becoming the associate director of programs; Rothkopf will still organize exhibitions.
lead_paragraph: Music, poetry and dance will play a role in the Museum of Modern Art’s “Inventing Abstraction, 1910-1925,” which opens Dec. 23.

headline.main: ‘Inventing Abstraction’ at MoMA, Collaboration With WQXR
headline.print_headline: Blending Art With Music at MoMA
